subsc:
General water, sanitation and flood

trustfund: TF033504-ARGENTINA - SOCIAL PROTECTION,TF025271-PHRD-SECOND BASIC EDUCATION DEVELOPMENT

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is
            satisfactory, and sustainability is likely. Regardless of a
            challenging project design, implementation was successful
            due to the high commitment, and competence from both the
            Bank, and the Government staffs. The lessons suggest,
            overall, the importance of up front institutional
            relationships, which encourages cooperation, and
            coordination for implementation arrangements. The highly
            satisfactory performance of the Participatory Social
            Investment Fund (FOPAR), was built on a cautious, and
            conservative approach during the initial phase; through its
            rigid appraisal process, FOPAR established a trustworthy
            reputation, effectively guarding it from potential political
            interference; and, the focus on internal institution
            building, led to a highly effective management information
            system, unique in its design, and implementation process. On
            the other hand, the decentralized approach of the Social
            Information, Monitoring and Evaluation of Targeted Social
            Programs (SIEMPRO), yielded high benefits, enabling the
            provision of technical assistance to the provinces, which
            proved not only a highly cost effective approach, but
            reinforced the government policy of decentralizing execution
            of social programs.
